note.text: Although Islam forbids homosexuality, the practice of sex between adult men and boys aged 9 to 15 is a common cultural practice among some Pashtuns. Called “bacha bazi,” this custom is a clear violation of international human trafficking laws. However, it has often been overlooked by both Afghan and international authorities.

Any U.S. service member who witnesses this practice should not intervene directly, as this could endanger the life of the victim. Rather, they should report their observations in writing to their superiors.
